summary: Under its 287(g) program, U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement can enter into agreements with state and local law enforcement agencies to help enforce immigration laws. Since 2017, the program expanded from 35 to about 150 agreements and ICE now has two models in which such law enforcement agencies can participate. We found that ICE has some policies and procedures to oversee and manage the partner...
title: Immigration Enforcement: ICE Can Further Enhance Its Planning and Oversight of State and Local Agreements
